meanings.definition: To support or confirm the validity or accuracy of something.
meanings.sent1: She vouches for her friend's honesty.
meanings.sent2: He always vouches for the quality of this product.
meanings.sent3: The talking parrot vouches for the cat's innocence.
meanings.sent4: His track record vouches for his reliability.
meanings.sent5: The shining trophy vouches for her hard work.

meanings.definition: To give a guarantee or assurance.
meanings.sent1: The store vouches that the item is brand new.
meanings.sent2: I can vouch for his punctuality.
meanings.sent3: The wise old owl vouches for the safety of the forest.
meanings.sent4: Her smile vouches for her happiness.
meanings.sent5: The bright rainbow vouches for the passing storm.

meanings.definition: To assert or declare as a fact.
meanings.sent1: He vouches that he saw the UFO last night.
meanings.sent2: The witness vouches that the suspect was at the scene.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous monkey vouches that the bananas disappeared on their own.
meanings.sent4: The loud thunder vouches that a storm is coming.
meanings.sent5: The colorful painting vouches that the artist is talented.
